This survey is designed to collect anonymous feedback from all employees. Its purpose is to understand your perspective on our product safety culture and identify areas for improvement. Your honest and open feedback is essential and will be used to make our workplace safer for everyone.

**Instructions:** Please choose the answer that best reflects your experience and feelings. There are no right or wrong answers.

|  |  |  |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Section 1: Leadership and Management Commitment**  Purpose: To assess how visible and committed management is to product safety. | **Strongly Agree** | **Agree** | **Neutral** | **Disagree** | **Strongly Disagree** |
| 1. Senior managers consistently demonstrate a personal commitment to product safety (e.g., wearing the correct PPE, following all protocols). |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I believe our managers would prioritize product safety over production targets if there was a conflict. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I have seen leaders praise employees for following food safe practices |  |  |  |  |  |

|  |  |  |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Section 2: Communication and Information**  Purpose: To evaluate the clarity and effectiveness of our communication channels. | **Strongly Agree** | **Agree** | **Neutral** | **Disagree** | **Strongly Disagree** |
| 1. I have a clear understanding of my role in ensuring product safety. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. Information about product safety is easy to understand, even with pictures and simple language. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I know where to find important product safety information (e.g., updated SOPs, posters). |  |  |  |  |  |

| **Section 3: Training and Competence**  Purpose: To measure the perceived quality and impact of our training programs. | **Strongly Agree** | **Agree** | **Neutral** | **Disagree** | **Strongly Disagree** |
| 1. The product safety training I receive gives me the skills I need to do my job safely. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I believe the training has a lasting impact on how I perform my job. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I am confident that I know how to handle and report an out-of-specification or unsafe product. |  |  |  |  |  |

|  |  |  |  |  |  |

| **Section 4: Behaviour and Accountability**  Purpose: To gauge the on-the-floor culture of behaviour and responsibility. | **Strongly Agree** | **Agree** | **Neutral** | **Disagree** | **Strongly Disagree** |
| 1. I am comfortable speaking up to my manager / team leader if I see a product safety issue. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. My colleagues consistently follow product safety protocols, even when they are not being watched. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I feel empowered to stop a production line if I see a serious product safety problem. |  |  |  |  |  |

| 1. I know how and where to submit my feedback or suggestions about product safety. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I believe my feedback is taken seriously by management. |  |  |  |  |  |
| 1. I have seen changes implemented as a direct result of employee feedback. |  |  |  |  |  |
